description: Contacted traditional or community leaders
notes: W2-W6. 3-point scale (1=more than once 2=once 3=never). HIGHER=LESS participation

notes: W2-W6. 3-point scale (1=more than once 2=once 3=never). HIGHER=LESS participation

description: Contacted news media
notes: All waves. 3-point scale (1=more than once 2=once 3=never). HIGHER=LESS participation

description: Used force or violence for political cause

notes: W3-W6. 4-point scale (1=every election to 4=hardly ever). HIGHER=LESS participation

description: Which party or candidate voted for
notes: All waves. Country-specific party codes. Not directly comparable across countries

description: Attended campaign meeting or rally

description: Tried to persuade others to vote for candidate/party
notes: W1-W3 and W6. Missing W4-W5. W1-W2 (1=no 2=yes) vs W3/W6 (1=yes 2=no). W1-W2 need reversal

description: Worked or helped party/candidate in campaign
notes: All waves. W1-W2 (1=no 2=yes) vs W3-W6 (1=yes 2=no). W1-W2 need reversal

description: Assessment of election freeness and fairness
notes: W2-W6. 4-point scale (1=completely free/fair to 4=not free/fair). W3 adds 5th option (free but unfair). Higher=worse quality

description: How often elections offer real choice between parties
notes: W2-W6. Four point scale (1=always to 4=rarely). Higher=worse. Perception of electoral competitiveness

description: Democracy scale for country now (1-10)
notes: All waves. 10-point scale (1=completely undemocratic to 10=completely democratic). HIGHER=MORE democratic

description: Democracy scale for country 10 years ago
notes: All waves. 10-point scale (1=completely undemocratic to 10=completely democratic). HIGHER=MORE democratic

description: Expected democracy scale 10 years from now
notes: All waves. 10-point scale (1=completely undemocratic to 10=completely democratic). HIGHER=MORE democratic

description: Whether democracy is suitable for our country
notes: All waves. 10-point scale (1=completely unsuitable to 10=perfectly suitable). HIGHER=MORE suitable

description: Satisfaction with current government
notes: All waves. 4-point scale (1=very satisfied to 4=very dissatisfied). HIGHER=LESS satisfied

description: Support for strong leader who doesn't bother with elections
notes: All waves. 4-choice ordinal (1=strongly support to 4=strongly oppose). HIGHER=LESS authoritarian

description: Support for army rule
notes: All waves. 4-choice ordinal (1=strongly support to 4=strongly oppose). HIGHER=LESS authoritarian

description: Support for experts making decisions instead of government/elections
notes: All waves. 4-choice ordinal (1=strongly support to 4=strongly oppose). HIGHER=LESS authoritarian

description: How often use internet

description: Use social media to connect with other people

description: Use social media to share news or information

description: How often discuss political matters with family or friends
notes: Most waves. W1 (1=never to 5=very often) 5-point HIGHER=MORE. W2 (1=never to 3=frequently) 3-point HIGHER=MORE. W3-W6 (1=frequently to 3=never) HIGHER=LESS. Must reverse W1-W2. Different scale lengths require careful harmonization
